question: David is rolling a d20 die. How much more likely is it (expressed as a percentage) that he rolls a number greater than 1 than that he rolls two even numbers in a row?
answer:
There are 19 numbers greater than 1 on the dice, so the chances of rolling one of them are 19/20=95%.
The chance of rolling one even number is 50%, so the chance of rolling two in a row is 50% * 50% = 25%.
The difference between these two probabilities is 95% - 25% = 70%.
#### 70
